main event: Two round-shaped lights, the size of a pin head, flew in formation over N.W. Washington, D.C., on June 27, 1956.
interesting points: The lights were yellow in color,The objects moved in a circular path before disappearing to the east while climbing,The length of observation was extremely short, lasting 5-10 seconds,The sighting was classified as a Conclusible S/C despite its brief duration.
